nodes.title: URL, URI,URN
nodes.description: URL, URI,URN:

nodes.label: HTTP and other protocols
nodes.title: HTTP and other protocols
nodes.description: HTTP and other protocols: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SMTP

nodes.label: DNS and domain names
nodes.title: DNS and domain names
nodes.description: DNS and domain names: DNS (Domain Name System): A hierarchical decentralized naming system for computers, services, or any resource connected to the internet or a private network. Domain names: Human-readable names used to identify websites and other resources on the internet, typically consisting of a series of labels separated by dots.

nodes.label: IP addresses and network devices
nodes.title: IP addresses and network devices
nodes.description: IP addresses and network devices: IP addresses: Numeric labels assigned to devices connected to a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication. Network devices: Hardware devices such as routers, switches, and modems that facilitate communication between devices on a computer network.

nodes.label: HTML, CSS, JavaScript,Relational Data Model
nodes.title: HTML, CSS, JavaScript,Relational Data Model
nodes.description: HTML, CSS, JavaScript,Relational Data Model:

nodes.label: HTML and Document Object Mece （DOM）
nodes.title: HTML and Document Object Mece （DOM）
nodes.description: HTML and Document Object Mece （DOM）: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language): A markup language used for creating the structure and content of web pages. DOM (Document Object Model): A programming interface for web documents that represents the structure of HTML and XML documents as a tree-like structure

nodes.label: Cascaded Style Sheets （CSS）
nodes.title: Cascaded Style Sheets （CSS）
nodes.description: Cascaded Style Sheets （CSS）: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets): A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of HTML and XML documents, including colors, layouts, and fonts.

nodes.label: Javascript: Introduction
nodes.title: Javascript: Introduction
nodes.description: Javascript: Introduction: JavaScript: A high-level programming language used for creating interactive and dynamic content on web pages, such as animations, interactive forms, and responsive behavior.

nodes.label: Website data model and Relational data model
nodes.title: Website data model and Relational data model
nodes.description: Website data model and Relational data model:

nodes.label: SQL,DBdesign
nodes.title: SQL,DBdesign
nodes.description: SQL,DBdesign:

nodes.label: Data Model: 1NF, 2NF, 3NF
nodes.title: Data Model: 1NF, 2NF, 3NF
nodes.description: Data Model: 1NF, 2NF, 3NF: 1NF (First Normal Form), 2NF (Second Normal Form), 3NF (Third Normal Form)

nodes.label: Database: Building and using, MySQL
nodes.title: Database: Building and using, MySQL
nodes.description: Database: Building and using, MySQL: MySQL: A popular open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) that uses SQL for database management.

nodes.label: Basic SQL commands and scripting
nodes.title: Basic SQL commands and scripting
nodes.description: Basic SQL commands and scripting:

nodes.label: Server-side scripting, PHP
nodes.title: Server-side scripting, PHP
nodes.description: Server-side scripting, PHP:

nodes.label: Introduction to PHP
nodes.title: Introduction to PHP
nodes.description: Introduction to PHP: PHP (Hypertext Preprocessor) is a server-side scripting language used for web development.

nodes.label: PHP Data Object （PDO）
nodes.title: PHP Data Object （PDO）
nodes.description: PHP Data Object （PDO）: PDO is a PHP extension providing a uniform interface for accessing databases.

nodes.label: Querying databases from web applications
nodes.title: Querying databases from web applications
nodes.description: Querying databases from web applications: PHP can interact with databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, etc., to fetch, insert, update, and delete data.

nodes.label: PHP forms and security issues
nodes.title: PHP forms and security issues
nodes.description: PHP forms and security issues:

nodes.label: Markup injection
nodes.title: Markup injection
nodes.description: Markup injection: Occurs when user input is not properly sanitized, leading to the injection of HTML markup into the webpage.

nodes.label: SQL injection
nodes.title: SQL injection
nodes.description: SQL injection: A common attack where malicious SQL code is inserted into input fields to manipulate the database.

nodes.label: PHP injection
nodes.title: PHP injection
nodes.description: PHP injection: A common attack where malicious SQL code is inserted into input fields to manipulate the database.

nodes.label: Site structuring with PHP
nodes.title: Site structuring with PHP
nodes.description: Site structuring with PHP: PHP is often used to create dynamic web pages by embedding PHP code within HTML templates.

nodes.label: Cookies
nodes.title: Cookies
nodes.description: Cookies: Small pieces of data stored on the client-side to track user activity or preferences.

nodes.label: Cookie regulation in GDPR
nodes.title: Cookie regulation in GDPR
nodes.description: Cookie regulation in GDPR: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) imposes regulations on how websites handle user data, including the use of cookies.

nodes.label: Client-side scripting, web UX design
nodes.title: Client-side scripting, web UX design
nodes.description: Client-side scripting, web UX design:

nodes.label: Javascript basics and main functions
nodes.title: Javascript basics and main functions
nodes.description: Javascript basics and main functions: Javascript basics and main functions: JavaScript is a scripting language used for client-side web development. It enables interactive web elements and dynamic content.

nodes.label: Input validation in forms
nodes.title: Input validation in forms
nodes.description: Input validation in forms: Input validation in forms: JavaScript can validate user input in forms to ensure data integrity and security before submitting it to the server.

nodes.label: Regular expressions
nodes.title: Regular expressions
nodes.description: Regular expressions: Regular expressions: Regular expressions are patterns used to match character combinations in strings. They are often used in JavaScript for text search and manipulation.

nodes.label: AJAX （Asynchronous Java and XML） method for asynchronous communication
nodes.title: AJAX （Asynchronous Java and XML） method for asynchronous communication
nodes.description: AJAX （Asynchronous Java and XML） method for asynchronous communication: AJAX (Asynchronous JavaScript and XML): AJAX allows web pages to request and load data from a server asynchronously without reloading the entire page.

nodes.label: Website design for User Experience （UX）
nodes.title: Website design for User Experience （UX）
nodes.description: Website design for User Experience （UX）:

nodes.label: Personas
nodes.title: Personas
nodes.description: Personas: Personas: Fictional characters representing different user types or demographics.

nodes.label: Optimising website elements for best UX
nodes.title: Optimising website elements for best UX
nodes.description: Optimising website elements for best UX: Optimizing website elements for best UX: This involves designing intuitive navigation, clear calls-to-action, responsive layouts, fast loading times, accessible content, and visually appealing designs to enhance user satisfaction and engagement.

nodes.label: WebAPI and Web Scraping
nodes.title: WebAPI and Web Scraping
nodes.description: WebAPI and Web Scraping:

nodes.label: Harvesting data from the web
nodes.title: Harvesting data from the web
nodes.description: Harvesting data from the web: Harvesting data from the web: Extracting data from websites for various purposes such as analysis, research, or integration into other applications.

nodes.label: Web APIs
nodes.title: Web APIs
nodes.description: Web APIs: Web APIs: Application Programming Interfaces provided by web services to allow communication and interaction between different software systems over the internet.

nodes.label: REST Services
nodes.title: REST Services
nodes.description: REST Services: Representational State Transfer (REST) is a software architectural style for building distributed systems based on stateless communication over HTTP.

nodes.label: Examples popular Web APIs
nodes.title: Examples popular Web APIs
nodes.description: Examples popular Web APIs: Examples of popular Web APIs: Examples include social media APIs (e.g., Twitter API, Facebook Graph API), mapping APIs (e.g., Google Maps API, Mapbox API), weather APIs, payment gateway APIs, and more.

nodes.label: Data dumps and Open Data
nodes.title: Data dumps and Open Data
nodes.description: Data dumps and Open Data: Data dumps and Open Data: Some websites provide data dumps or openly accessible datasets for public use and analysis.

nodes.label: Web Scraping
nodes.title: Web Scraping
nodes.description: Web Scraping:

nodes.label: Restrictions
nodes.title: Restrictions
nodes.description: Restrictions: Restrictions: Some websites have terms of service or use legal mechanisms to prevent automated access or scraping of their data.

nodes.label: Scraping data
nodes.title: Scraping data
nodes.description: Scraping data: Scraping data: Extracting specific information or content from web pages programmatically using web scraping techniques.

nodes.label: Web scraping with PHP
nodes.title: Web scraping with PHP
nodes.description: Web scraping with PHP: PHP libraries and frameworks such as Guzzle and Symfony HttpClient can be used for web scraping tasks in PHP-based projects.

nodes.label: Web scraping/Web sourcing with Python BeautifuISoup package
nodes.title: Web scraping/Web sourcing with Python BeautifuISoup package
nodes.description: Web scraping/Web sourcing with Python BeautifuISoup package: BeautifulSoup is a Python library for parsing HTML and XML documents

nodes.label: Web Application Security
nodes.title: Web Application Security
nodes.description: Web Application Security:

nodes.label: Securing your website, login, authentication
nodes.title: Securing your website, login, authentication
nodes.description: Securing your website, login, authentication: Implementing robust authentication mechanisms, such as password hashing, multi-factor authentication, and session management, to protect user accounts and prevent unauthorized access.

nodes.label: Different aspects of Security as technology and service domain
nodes.title: Different aspects of Security as technology and service domain
nodes.description: Different aspects of Security as technology and service domain: Security encompasses various aspects, including network security, application security, data security, and physical security.

nodes.label: Security foundations and Internet security
nodes.title: Security foundations and Internet security
nodes.description: Security foundations and Internet security: Understanding foundational security principles, such as confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA triad), and applying security measures to protect against threats on the Internet.

nodes.label: VPN,DNS security
nodes.title: VPN,DNS security
nodes.description: VPN,DNS security: Using Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) to establish secure, encrypted connections over untrusted networks, and implementing DNS security measures, such as DNSSEC (Domain Name System Security Extensions)

nodes.label: Access control and Single Sign On （SSO）
nodes.title: Access control and Single Sign On （SSO）
nodes.description: Access control and Single Sign On （SSO）: Managing user access to resources based on permissions and roles, and enabling Single Sign-On solutions to allow users to authenticate once and access multiple systems or applications securely.

nodes.label: Standards and best practices: CVE and OWASP
nodes.title: Standards and best practices: CVE and OWASP
nodes.description: Standards and best practices: CVE and OWASP:

nodes.label: DNS attacks
nodes.title: DNS attacks
nodes.description: DNS attacks: Understanding common DNS attacks such as DNS spoofing, DNS amplification attacks, and DNS tunneling, and implementing countermeasures to protect DNS infrastructure and ensure the integrity of DNS resolution.

nodes.label: Mobile devices and smartphones security architecture
nodes.title: Mobile devices and smartphones security architecture
nodes.description: Mobile devices and smartphones security architecture: Implementing security measures on mobile devices and smartphones, including secure boot, encrypted storage, application sandboxing, and mobile device management (MDM) solutions
